p: According to the results, the oral texture of probiotic yogurts containing 0.4% of extract and 0.03% of FAEO was not significantly different from the control treatment ( p < .05). In these treatments, the oral texture score was higher than probiotic yogurts containing 0.2% extract and 0.01% FAEO ( p < .05). In evaluating the sensory characteristics of the nonoral tissue, after the control treatment, the highest score was obtained by probiotic yogurts containing 0.01% and 0.03% essential oil of F. angulata. In terms of the general acceptance of the evaluators, the most desirable treatment was the probiotic yogurt containing 0.03% of FAEO. Comparison of sensory properties of herbal probiotic yogurts has been shown in Figure 3.
